main event: Three lights, one bigger than the other two, were observed by a civilian witness in Waverly, New York on January 3, 1956. The objects appeared to be yellow in color with red flashes and moved straight up and down rapidly.
interesting points: The objects did not move around but rather appeared to move straight up and down very rapidly.
The observer reported that on January 6th, he observed several more lights like these.
The larger light was at an elevation of 65 degrees 32 minutes and disappeared and reappeared several times, changing place in the sky.
The objects were described as appearing to be 'rolling with red flashes'.
The sighting lasted for approximately 30 minutes.
sighted object: Three lights, one larger than the other two
